Package supermart.backEnd

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<Item,java.lang.Integer>
      • supermart.backEnd.Stock

  • public class Stock
extends java.util.AbstractMap<Item,java.lang.Integer>
    Author:
    Zaine Ashe - 09469010 Builds a stock for use with Trucks, Stores and Manifests.

    Builds a stock used to contain Item and Item information. Used by both Trucks, Stores and Manifests as a list of items they carry.

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public boolean addItem​(Item item)
        Adds an item to the stock.

        Adds the specified item into the stock with a starting quantity of 0.

        Parameters:
        item - The item to be added into the stock
        Returns:
        true or false whether or not the item is initialised in the stock

      • removeItem

        public boolean removeItem​(Item item)
        Removes an item from the stock.

        Checks to see if the item is already in the stock, if so it removes the specified item from the stock. This happens from the hashmap so the item is entirely removed.

        Parameters:
        item - The item to be removed from the stock
        Returns:
        true or false echoeing the success of the removeItem method

      • SetQuantity

        public void SetQuantity​(Item item,
                        int quantity)
                 throws StockException
        Sets the quantity of an item in the stock.

        First checks to ensure the item is in the stock, then sets the specified quantity for the item. Throws StockException if a negative quantity is attempted.

        Parameters:
        item - The item to be modified
        quantity - The quantity to be added to the item, must be positive
        Throws:
        StockException - Thrown when a negative quantity is attempted

      • AddQuantity

        public boolean AddQuantity​(Item item,
                           int quantity)
        Adds a set amount to the quantity of an item in the stock

        Checks that the item is in the stock, then adds the amount to the quantity of an item in the stock.

        This method was built for quick and neat testing and shouldn't be called outside of tests if at all possible.

        Parameters:
        item - The item to be added into the stock
        quantity - The quantity to be added to the item's quantity
        Returns:
        true/false based on whether or not the safe method AddQuantity succeeds

      • CountUniqueItems

        public int CountUniqueItems​()
        Returns the count of each unique item in the stock

        Only returns the count of unique items in the stock, if an item has a quantity higher than one it is still only counted once.

        Returns:
        The count of unique items currently in the stock

      • Contains

        public boolean Contains​(Item item)
        Searches to find the specified item in the stock.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true or false based on whether or not the item is in the stock

      • Contains

        Returns:
